title.narrative: STAKEHOLDERS' ENGAGEMENT ON CHILDREN

description.narrative: The Government, opinion influencers and Civil Society organizations have increased information, capacity and platforms to advocate for children's issues, particularly for the most deprived and vulnerable children, which contributes to Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Psfr Modalities Non-Post. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Rights of children are advanced through strategic partnerships, advocacy, behavioural development, community transformation and innovative service delivery solutions

participating-org.narrative: STATE MINISTRY OF SOCIAL DEVELOPMEN CULTURE YOUTH AND SPORT

Management of advocacy and communication at HQ

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: No. of South Sudan journalists trained to report ethically on children's issues

actual.value: 2015:No media monitoring capacity in South Sudan. Ongoing engagement with national and international media. Increase of social media coverage to 5,967 followers on Tweeter and 51,230 on Facebook
